1.content:
First choice will be timelines and possibilities. Some may be related to the game, some may not.

1. - Before the Game. In this timeline events happen before any events of the game took place. That means going so far back the royal family is still together, Asriel is fine and living with his parents together in the royal palace. Neither the fallen child nor Frisk has arrived at this time so things here change if the events of the game happened at all.

2. - During the Game. These events take place any time after Asriel has been lost and Toriel and Asgore have separated. Things can happen any time between then and the end of the game. That does not mean it has to follow the events of the game, just that it happens somewhere in the time frame of the game.

3. - After the Game. Monsters are now living on the surface thanks to saving them at the good ending of the game. The races co-mingle and everyone is helping to start anew. Asriel might even be saved thanks to the endless Determination of Frisk.

4. - Alternate universe. In this reality Asriel never lost his soul. He grew up to be a strong and handsome young prince of the Underground. A land where monsters choose to live but can visit the surface any time.

5. - Something else. Have a different idea for an alternate timeline? Start it here.
1.title: Choose Your Destiny...

112312.content:
Every monster in the underground had heard of the young cerulean prodigy, the fish girl that had been tirelessly training under King Asgore since she had eagerly tried to defeat him in one on one combat. She had spend her teen years trying to best him, to land a single hit and prove herself to be the strongest. Now that she had become of age, that day seemed to be closer than ever. Talk began to spread that Asgore may even make her the captain of the royal guard! This was something that did not sit well with other... Less pure of heart monsters, who had been training for that very position as long, if not longer than Undyne.

The culprits met each other one quiet night in the forest of Snowden. Three hooded figures met in a clearing, the shortest of the three producing a rather thick book bound in black leather. "I think I've found just the thing to take care of our fish problem..." The short figure said, placing the book upon a stump as they began to flip through its pages. The tallest figure snorted, "Oh my, now where did you find such a grimoire..?" The third, widest figure added, "And now just any grimoire. That there's older, more sinister magic..." The short figure bragged, "You'd be shocked what kind of secrets are left laying around in the royal archives... Anyways, as I was saying." The short one suddenly stopped flipping through the pages, finding the curse they had picked out from earlier. "Look at this."

The figures poured over the page, the tall one laughing, the wide one tapping their chin in intrigue. The wide one spoke, "Well well, I admire your creativity." The tall one bellowed, "Ahahaha! It's too perfect! With all those weird human animes our fish has been indulging herself in... She'll finally look like one!" The short one finished, "Oh believe me, she'll be wishing they were that small when we're done..!" The three conspiring figures then began to perform the ritual detailed in the book...

Undyne tossed and turned in her sleep. She was beginning to sweat, her room reeking of warm sushi. Well, more than usual anyways. Her chest was starting to get very sore, each bud where her breasts should have grown in were starting to itch! The soreness turned into a painful numbing sensation, each space on her chest throbbing with a pins and needles feeling. The same you'd get if you fell asleep on your arm, or the kind you'd get in your cheeks if you blew into a balloon too hard...

The fish finally woke up, coated in sweat and dizzy. "W-whuh... Who's there? What's...?" As Undyne gained consciousness, her eyes focused on something strange. Two little tents stood in her typical black tank top. "N-nnn...." She began to groan, eyes widened, "NGAAAAAHHHH?!" She cried out, gripping each tent in her shirt. She felt a small amount of soft flesh pushing back against her palms, "I-I have... Boobies?!?!" Undyne called out in both shock and excitement! They were merely small B cups, but they still felt slightly sore... As if she were still experiencing growing pains...

How does this curse proceed?

114.title: Asriel

1141.content:
Asriel dreamed that he was floating in darkness, a endless void where time and space was nonexistent. He felt warm, safe, but not completely comfortable. The goat boy didn't know why but for some reason he could feel an intense pressure around his mid section, a pressure so bad that it felt like he was going to pop.

Asriel wondered why he felt like this, searching his body all over. He looked completely normal, a scrawny goat child with a striped t-shirt and black pants. Maybe he should...

"Beep! Beep! Beep!"

With a muffled gasp, Asriel's eyes popped open. He was greeted with darkness again, but this time he could see shapes that could be identified as furniture and walls. He was in his room, tucked away in his bed.

Asriel became aware of the alarm clock still buzzing next to him, and he silenced it. Rubbing the sleep away from his eyes, the goat boy attempted to rise, but he felt a heavy weight press down on his abdominal.

Squinting, his eyes adjusting to the darkness, Asriel could make out a bulge the size of a basketball under his covers. Growing concerned, Asriel reached to the lamp next to his bed and turned it on. Now with better light, Asriel threw away his covers to identify the bulge.

What he found made him groan in frustration, thumping his head back on his pillow. "O, great!" he mumbled, "Another food coma!"

Asriel watched his hands run over his bloated tummy, which was the bulge that he saw earlier. He could feel how his skin felt as taut as a over inflated balloon, his stomach making furious gurgling sounds.

It was straining against the buttons of his night shirt, which was ironically patterned with pictures of Butterscotch and Cinnamon pie, the very food that bloated his gut to this immense size. Though, it wasn't his fault.

Over the past month and a half Toriel had been acting strangely. The goat boy was used to his mother's love and how she would enjoy eating her cooking, but recently Asriel noticed that she was making larger and more pies for him.

She would beg him to eat every slice, and after he was filled to bursting Toriel would urge him to devour more. Asriel would tell her that he had enough, but then his mother would get that look in her eye.

It was a look that could melt his heart, a look that he dreaded more than her anger or scolding. It was the look of disappointment. When he saw this, Asriel would take up another slice, force it down his throat, and do the same with other she brought to him, devouring tin after tin until he felt drowsy, going off into a food coma.

Afterwards, he would wake up here, no doubted moved by his caring mother and even dressed in his pajamas. Asriel wondered how she got the buttons over the large ball of flesh. She probably used magic. But that was the least of his problems.

As Asriel stood in front of the mirror, after he heaved himself out of bed, cradling his heavy belly to the wardrobe, he knew this had to stop very soon. He was soon re-dressed in his usual clothes, but he saw that it wasn't coping well with his weight gain.

His belly had grown so big that it caused his shirt to ride up inches above his navel. His moobs were developing, visibly pressing against his shirt too. His shorts felt tight, his love handles spilling over the waist line.

He lifted his one arm, studying it, and he saw that it, along with his legs, were much thicker, stressing the seams of his shirt. He pressed his hands against his cheeks and he felt how soft it was, for it was becoming rounder, a double chin developing.

Yes, this had to stop soon, or he would end up unable to do anything soon. Asriel decided that he needed to go out, get some exercise, go on a diet. Smiling, he waddled out of the room, his feet thumping against the floorboards.

But when he approached the kitchen, the goat boy could smell the scent of food. His mother was cooking again. Asriel bit his lower lip, which was a little bit thicker than usual. He knew what this meant. If she caught him he would have no chance.

Asriel had to be very careful now. He began to tiptoe, but when he was almost at the door a floorboard creaked mercilessly loud under his weight.

"Asriel?" Toriel called from the kitchen, "Is that you?"

The goat boy gave a silent gasp. Though, he could still make it. He quickly waddled to the door, not caring anymore about the dozens of floorboards creaking under his weight.

He reached to the door handle, but did he manage to get outside?
1141.title: A bit too much motherly love.

choices: Before he could decide, something else happens.
11411.content:
A beeping in the kitchen was the sound of Asriel's freedom. Not wanting to let her latest creation burn, the sound of Toriel's footsteps retreated to the kitchen. Giving Asriel enough time in turn to slip out the door wand waddle down the path.

Once out of sight he heaved a sigh of relief. He loved his mother dearly and her cooking was incredibly wonderful, but there was just so much of it Asriel had a hard time eating it all. If only she made smaller portions...

Putting it out of his mind for now, Asriel wandered out and down the path out along the upper level that overlooked the capitol city. It was a fairly busy place, monsters moved all about among the grey stone buildings. And yet it was eerie. So many buildings were just left empty, only about one in three had anyone living in them.

Asriel had never questioned it before, but as he waddled along the path now it certainly seemed odd. Finally, panting just a little, he made it to the elevator. He wasn't looking forward to the next leg of things, but his mom would find him soon if he didn't keep moving. So he chose to ride the elevator down to the hottest location in the underground.

Arriving in Hotland, Asriel's fur dampened with sweat in minutes and his panting became stronger. Fortunately there were some respites like the hotel which he eagerly accepted in order to enjoy the cool air conditioner.

"Hey," came the voice of a monster behind the counter of a nearby burger joint, "No loitering kid. Sorry. If you want to stick around maybe you could buy something?"

Asriel groaned at the thought of more food, but his belly burbled in agreement. In the end he reluctantly bought a burger and a soda. He tried to make them last as he enjoyed the cool hotel lobby, sitting by the fountain and enjoying the soft splashes of water, but all too soon (sooner than he'd intended) he finished his burger and soda. Incredibly Asriel considered buying another just to stay there, but he had to keep moving. His Mom would be searching for him and much as he loved her food, anything she offered plus the burger he'd just consumed, he was sure would be enough to make him burst something.

Of course he'd barely left the hotel and traveled down the steps, near where the royal labs were when another friendly monster offered him a free sample of something he called 'Nicecream'. And it was nice. Again Asriel might have resisted but the heat from the lava flows was intolerable on his own padding.

Fortunately he just had to go a little further before he found the ferryman, a strange hooded monster who held others get around.

"Where too son?" the figure asked.

Asriel considered it. one the one hand Waterfall was closer, but it was home to Undyne, the head of the palace guard.She was sure to hold Asriel until his mom showed up. Provided he ran into her at all. Snowden was probably safer, but it was closer to their other home, and Toriel was likely to guess her son was making his way there.

Where does Asriel go?
11411.title: Hotland Escape

114111.content:
Asriel pondered for a few moments and came to a conclusion: he would go to the waterfalls. It was the last place his mother would think to look for him; the chunky goat boy had no extra home there, like in the ruins, and no friends or family members to stay with.

Of course there was the threat of Undyne finding him, but Asriel, ten spite his corpulent state, was confident that he could avoid her.

"To the waterfalls," he said.

The Ferryman nodded and Asriel jumped aboard, causing the boat's back to dip greatly and the front to rise high due to the added weight. Ten spite how awkwardly it now stood in the waters, it sailed anyway forward to the waterfalls.

"Tra la la la!" the Ferryman sang, "Hmmm, it appears that my boat had sprung a leak."

Asriel didn't know what he meant, for he saw no leaks in the boat. He then realised the the Ferryman might be slyly referencing to his weight. Asriel felt slightly offended, folding his thick arm across his moobs, but he didn't say anything.

A few minutes later Asriel arrived at his destination and jumped out, causing the boat's front to fall back into the water, sending a large splash that made the goat boy a little wet.

"Bye," Asriel waved his hand to the Ferryman as he climbed the stairs, who waved back.
114111.title: To the waterfalls.

choices: He heard a familiar noise behind him.
He heard someone calling his name.
1141111.content:
Asriel was amazed of how unfit he was. The flight of stairs weren't even that long, but the goat boy found himself exhausted, like he ran a mile non stop. He leaned heavily against a wall, panting and sweating a little.

His pants were digging painfully into his waist and butt, and Asriel had to tuck at it and readjust it. After he rested, the goat boy pressed onwards. He was going to Tammie Village, where he knew that he would be safe for a while.

He decided to speed-walk, something he always saw some monsters back at the city, for his first exercise for the day, his butt cheeks sliding up and down against each other.

As he walked, Asriel took in his surroundings. The light blue glow of the rivers and plant life gave the area a magical and otherworldly air. It was beautiful to Asriel. So mesmerized was the chunky goat boy that he didn't look were he was going and nearly fell into a river.

After he cart wheeled his arms to gain balance, he took a step back from the edge and looked for a bridge, but there was none. Asriel groaned, knowing that he had to swim across.

He jumped into the cool water, which came up to his flabby chest, and waded across. The current luckily wasn't strong and he could reach the other bank without delay, dragging his fat and wet body out of the river.

He got to his feet and proceeded onwards, but suddenly his clothes were feeling tight on him again. Asriel tried to adjust his clothes again, but to his horror saw that it was shrinking. He didn't know why at first, but then he remembered that his clothing was made out of material which, if not handled properly, shrank in cold water.

Asriel was able to get his shirt off, but his pants was another story. It shrank so badly that it couldn't slide down his thighs, fitting him like a second skin, large tears appearing in his pants. Asriel groaned again.

"Dammit, could this day get any worse?" Asriel thought in frustration.

Just then it did...
1141111.title: The shrinking clothing dilemma.

choices: Asriel's pot-belly began to rumble, giving him away.
11411111.content:
"Clank, Clank, Clank!"

The familiar sound of heavy boots striking the ground, of armor rattling, made Asriel's blood run cold. It was no doubt one of the Royal Guards, and he knew exactly who it was. Asriel looked frantically around, searching for a hiding place, and he spotted one just up the road.

A large amount of bushes filled the pathway. They, Asriel guessed, would come up just below his chin, and if he crouched down he would remain completely hidden. He waddled as quickly as he could, diving into the bushes. Soon enough, Undyne arrived.

Asriel watched her from the bushes. She was dressed from head to heel in armor, holding her glowing spear. To the goat boy she looked every inch like a stoic warrior. No wonder she was head of the Royal Guards.

Undyne suddenly came to a halt, bending and picking up Asriel's shirt. The goat boy cursed himself inwardly for not taking it along with him. She held it, holding it in both hands and studying it, noting a few tears in it, which had appeared when it was shrinking on Asriel's thick frame.

Undyne scanned the area for a few seconds, then began to walk again, shirt still in hand. On his hands and knees, his belly almost in the dirt, Asriel watched her move by with relief. Suddenly, his pants, under enormous strain from his ample behind, gave way with a loud rip, revealing his underwear beneath.

Asriel grit his teeth, his eyes growing wide. Undyne stopped dead in her tracks and looked towards where the sound came from. She was staring directly at where Asriel was hiding. The goat boy was frozen in fear.

A few minutes, which felt like hours to Asriel, passed, and, thankfully, Undyne proceeded to walk away, this time more slowly. What happens next?
11411111.title: Hiding from Undyne.

114111111.content:
Asriel's doughy belly gave a loud rumble, his gnawing hunger returning and his stomach demanding for food. Undyne's head whipped towards the sound, staring directly at him again. His rumbling tummy had given him away.

While Asriel tried to flee, crawling away, Undyne jumped into the air, coming down with a thud that shook the very ground next to the goat boy. Her hand lashed out, grabbing Asriel's pants and hoisting him up by it, giving him a wedgy he wouldn't soon forget

As she turned to inspect him, and Asriel heard Undyne gasp. She quickly changed the way she was grasping him, holding him now under his armpits. Lifting her visor, revealing her face that had a triumphant grin on it.

"H-hi, Undyne," Asriel greeted her with a sheepish smile.

"Hu ha!" she cried, "Finally I've found you. We've all been looking for you. You're momma is worried sick about you. Why did you run off like that?"

It was now the goat boy's chance to convince her to let him go. "Undyne, please, listen," Asriel said, "I can't go back. My mom's been over feeding. I'm turning into a blimp. You can't send me back, please!"

But Undyne only shook her head. "Nonsense," she said, "You're going straight home."

She held him under her arm as she proceeded to walk, Asriel desperately kicking and flailing his arms. "Please, Undyne, you-"

He was cut off when she said sternly, "No buts, young goat. You're going home, whether you like it or not. Understand?"

Defeated, Asriel said, "Yes, ma'am."
114111111.title: Caught!

1141111111.content:
Yes, your majesty, I have him right here...huh ha...Yes, I'll keep him here until you arrive...huh ha...O, yes, I'll take very good care of him, don't you worry...OK, bye."

Undyne put the telephone down, turned to the table where Asriel sat and clasped her hands together, a grin on her face.

"Your mother would be here soon," she said, "So, you better eat up all your food quickly."

"Yes, ma'am," Asriel said, and he obediently shoveled in the stack of pancakes that almost touched the ceiling, drenched in maple syrup.

The goat boy felt frustrated and angry at himself. Of course the head of the Royal Guards were bond to catch. Why did he ever think that his chubby, clumsy body would be able to avoid her?

Though, it could be worse; Asriel's stomach was singing with joy as the delicious food fell into it, and he was properly dressed for ones. The goat boy would never know where Undyne found a bigger striped shirt or pants, or why she had an extra pair in the first place.

Asriel knew that he would be three pounds heavier after this "snack", but that would be nothing compared to what his mother has in store for him. Perhaps...perhaps he could try his luck and convince her to stop over feeding him. It was worth a shot, especially when his mother didn't have food with her at the moment.

XxxX

With her hand firmly wrapped around Asriel's, Toriel led her son to the nearest elevator to go home.

"I don't understand," she was saying, "Why would you run off like that, my child?'

It was now or never. Asriel had to scrape together the courage and tell her the truth, even if it would hurt her feelings.

"I-I just couldn't take it anymore, mom," Asriel said, "Your food was just too much."

"Y-y-you don't like my cooking?" Toriel said, her face both a mixture of sadness and shock.

"No, no, no!" Asriel quickly jumped in as they stepped into an elevator, "It's not that. I love your cooking. Really, I do. It's just..."

He lifted his love handles and jiggled his belly. "It's just too much!" Asriel said, "I'm getting too fat. If I eat all your enormous amount of cooking, I'll turn into a blob. I don't want that, please! I would still eat all your food, but you need to make it in smaller portions. You need to stop over feeding me."

Toriel nodded her head in understanding. "If that is what you want, Asriel, then I will stop over feeding you," she said.

"Thanks, mom," the goat boy said, relieved that he finally had that off his chest.

With a disappointed sigh, Toriel went to push the button that would take them to the city, but then she stopped, thinking something over. She changed her mind, pressing the button that would take them to the Hotlands instead. Toriel had a plan
1141111111.title: At Undyne's house.

choices: As he grows Asriel's body begins changing...
Toriel talks about her plan for Asriel to Alphus
11411111111.content:
"Buuuuuuuuuuuuuuurrrrrrp!"

The echo of the monstrous belch bounced off the metal walls and even made the very ground shake, like an earth tremor had moved through it. It even made the chemical bottles in laboratory shake and clank together.

"Does my little fat prince feel hungry for more, hmm?"

Toriel ran her hand over Asriel's huge, bloated, sphere of a gut, which felt as taut as an over inflated balloon, nearly as big as her whole body. It was a marvel that he hadn't burst yet. The goat boy only moaned in response, feeling light headed and very tired.

He could feel another food coma coming. Asriel didn't understand it. Why did his mother break her promise? She wasn't suppose to over feed him, let alone force feed him. But the more Asriel thought about it, the more it made sense.

Technically Toriel didn't break her promise. She wasn't the one force feeding him. Alphys was. In her massive test room, the royal scientist was using the goat boy as a test subject for a new feeder she invented for some reason.

It was a reservoir that had a hose attached to it, which had a clamp that was tied around Asriel's mouth, preventing him from spitting it out and forcing him to swallow the pink sludge that came from it. Whatever it was that he was eating, it didn't taste bad.

In fact, it was so great that Asriel was always graving for more, never satisfied no matter how much he drank, even though he was stuffed like a turkey.

"I'll take that as a no then," Toriel said.

Toriel fastened the hose back on Asriel mouth. She turned back to Alphys, who was standing behind a glass window, and gave her a thumbs-up, signaling her to begin again. The scientist nodded and pressed a button on the panel before her.

The machine came to life, and Asriel could taste the delicious sludge filling his mouth. He began to swallow it, and with each swallow his belly got even bigger with the sound of a stretching balloon. Toriel could only watch her son grow with a happy smile.

She reached over to a bottle filled with a special lotion and began to rub some of it on his growing gut. The stretching sound began to quiet down, and the redness around his outie belly button began to fade back to white.

Asriel couldn't help but moan pleasure. His mother's hands were working magic across his bloated tummy. He began to dose off, his body swallowing the sludge by itself. Asriel wondered how large he'll be when he wakes up.
11411111111.title: Forcefeeding Asriel.

114111111114.content: How about the feeding machine breaks?
114111111114.title: Something else happened.

choices: Asriel finds all the shiny rocks.
114111112.content:
Although it took only a few minutes for Undyne to leave, but to Asriel it felt like forever. He stayed there for a few moments longer, just to make sure that she was really gone. When it seems that she was, Asriel stood up, wiping the dirt off his ruined pants.

Asriel studied himself and knew that he must get some new clothes. He couldn't walk around like this. At the Temmie Village he was going to buy just that. He had some GP left in the pocket of his torn pants.

XxxX

"Hoi!! Welcom to Tam Village!" the cute little dog exclaimed, "My name Temmie! And this is my friend, Temmie." She indicated to another dog next to her, which looked identical to her.

"That's nice," said Asriel kindly, trying to suppress his growing frustration, "but all I want to know his where the shop is?"

He didn't receive any answer. The cute dog only stared at him blankly, as if she didn't understand what he was saying.

Asriel groaned. "Never mind," he said and waddled away.

He found the shop on his own and went inside, and Asriel was greeted by another Temmie, this one differing slightly in color. It's mouth, eyes and nose swam around her face, like it had a mind of its own, not completely attached to her head.

The sight was slightly freaky to Asriel, but he chose to ignore it. Clothing was the most important necessity right now.

"Hoi! Welcom to Tem Shop!" the cute dog exclaimed happily, "Tem got stuff. Buy?"

"Yes," Asriel said, "Do you have clothes, big ones?"

The cute dog blinked. "Tem got clothes!" the cute dog said, "Tem got lots and loads of stuff!"

A few moments later Asriel was dressed in clothes the goat boy could only describe as armor. It had steel padding on his shoulders and knees, a helmet, and the rest was chainmail. He would have looked like a badass, just like Undyne, in it, but his fat body ruined it.

"That be 100 GP!" the cute dog exclaimed, holding out her paw.

"What!?" Asriel shouted in surprise, "I don't have that much money."

The Temmie gave him a blank stare, the typical one he received when they didn't understand what he said.

At first Asriel though that he had to repeat himself, but then she spoke, "Temmie know how you could purchise Tem armor. Go get ten shiny rocks for Tem."

Asriel didn't know what these shiny rocks were, or where to find them (they were most likely somewhere in this area), but the goat boy knew he had no choice, for he wouldn't get no bargain better.

"Can I still keep the armor on?" Asriel asked.

"Sure!" the cute dog said with a friendly smile.

Asriel smiled too and said, "Thanks."

He left.
114111112.title: Asriel waited until she left.

1141111121.content:
In Asriel's arms was ten of the shiny rocks the Tammie had requested him to get. It was easier to find them than the goat boy had expected. The were so dark that they seemed like tiny abysses, standing out from the green glow of the surroundings.

He was glad that, on his search, didn't run into Undyne again. Luck favored him ones, but he wasn't sure if he would be able to escape a second time, for the armor that he wore was noisy and the plant life around here was sparse.

As Asriel wuddled back to the village, wondering why would the Temmie possibly need something that, to him, seemed useless, a flickering light caught his attention. Looking down, he saw that one of the rocks had changed color from black to blue.

Asriel eyes widened in horror. He knew what these things were. With a gasp, he dropped the "shiny rocks" to the ground, where all ten of them shifted between a series of bright colors rapidly. What he had touched was objects of rare and dangerous magic.

Before his mother decided to fatten him up for no good reason, Toriel had taught him about these crystals, how they stored an immense amount of power, but not enough to rival that of a Soul. Still, if one came into contact of them, and didn't handle them properly, they could expect some bizarre changes to happen to them.

Right at this moment Asriel could feel that bizarre changes happened to him, his large stomach gurgling, as he began to...
1141111121.title: Asriel finds all the shiny rocks.

choices: They make it to Sans' house.
114112.content:
After giving it some thought, Asriel decided that it would be best if he head to Snowden. At least there there would be a large area for him to hide in, and he had no fear that anyone would stop him and take him back to his mother.

Smiling, Asriel said: "To Snowden."

The goat boy hopped on the little boat, which caused the back to dip deeply and the front to rise greatly due to his heavy bulk, but it stayed afloat and it began to sail towards Snowden.

"Tra la la la!" the Ferryman sang, "Oh no! My boat is sinking! Or perhaps my load is heavier than I anticipated."

Asriel frowned, folding his thick arms and giving a snort in irritation, catching the obvious reference to his weight. A few minutes later Asriel arrived at his destination, and he hopped off, the boat's front falling back into the water, sending waves splashing everywhere.

"Thanks," Asriel said, waving as the Ferryman left.

The goat boy turned to the stairs that led to Snowden, and he couldn't help but shiver, then spit his padding. It was very cold here, his warm breath steaming in the freezing air.

Clutching both his upper arms, he began to try and warm it up with friction as he began to climb the stairs. But that wasn't necessary. After he climbed to the top Asriel was already feeling hot, panting.

He pulled at his skin-tight shorts, which was beginning to ride up on him due to all the movement. Asriel honestly needed bigger clothes, and he finally decided that he would get just that here in Snowden.

After catching his breath, the goat boy began to head towards the small town, following a snow-covered road that ran through the woods. But as he waddled, he began to grow uneasy, for he felt that he was being watched.

She loved teaching both the monsters and the children there, so much so, she sometimes call them her '2nd family'.
It was the middle of the school year and Toriel was finishing up a lesson about caverns and caves.
"So, remember," she said after a video about stalagmites and stalactites "stalagmites might touch the roof while stalactites could touch the ground." Toriel was wearing a purple dress with a purple top, and had purple glasses. She wasn't wearing any shoes, but that was expected.
"Well, children," she said as the students finished writing down the last of the notes "I do hope you all have a safe weekend and-" she was interrupted by a flurry of hands raising. "Er, yes?" Toriel asked as she pointed to a human child.
"Miss Dreamurr, we've been good all month, right? You said that if we were good all month, you would show us a spell." The child said.
Toriel looked to a calender and saw it was the last day of the month.
"Oh, Dear, I almost forgot!" Toriel said with a smile. "I'll be right back." She then walked to the back of the room and entered a room filled with books, plants, and snails. She browsed through the books before finding the one she was looking for: the book of size manipulation. She grabbed the book, some plates and a couple of snails, and walked to the front of the classroom. The human and monster children all gathered around Toriel's desk.
Toriel placed the snails on separate plates and opened the book. For a few moments, she flipped through the book, looking for the spell she needed, until she found the growth spell.
"Now, children," Toriel started "This spell is an advanced spell, so please don't try this at home unless you have the proper training."
She then rolled up her sleeves, hovered her hands over the book, then began to, motion them in circles. At first, nothing happened, just Toriel waving her hands, but suddenly, white flames engulfed her hands, causing some of the students to squeal in shock.
"Its okay, children, I am perfectly safe."
She continued to move her hands in circles, but suddenly, the school bell rang, signaling the end of the day.
"Oh, sorry, children, but it seems we will have to wait until monday."
The children groaned, but still packed up their stuff and left the room. Toriel sighed, she wanted to show the children the growth spell, but it seems that it will have to wait. She quickly shook her hands (a standard way to cancel spells that have a fire to them), and waited for the flames to be extinguished. She kept on shaking, until the flames suddenly flung off her hands and started ricocheting off the walls. Toriel quickly made a dash to the door, hoping the spell would hit something, but then she felt a sudden pain in her rear, as though someone slapped her. She looked and saw a singe mark on her dress where she felt the pain and started rubbing it. She then felt another pain in her breasts, like those were slapped, too. She looked at them and saw a singe mark on her shirt where the pain was.
"Oh, dear..." Toriel muttered as she rubbed there, too.

He was no longer human, for the bond that they shared had transformed him for some reason. Instead, he was now a goat boy, like Asriel. The only thing remaining of his former humanity was his brown hair.

Though they weren't actually related, it felt good for Asriel to call Frisk his brother, especially after that selfless act he performed for him, giving him a second chance at life again.

There was just one problem. It worried Asriel greatly that Frisk had seemingly a never ending appetite. It began after the returned to the surface world, and it seemed to increase daily.

Even now his brother was wolfing down a bags of chips, cookies, and other sweets. He was always hungry. But no matter how much he ate, Asriel saw, Frisk never seemed to gain any weight. It was bizarre.

Asriel, on the other hand, found that he had little appetite lately, but, for some reason, if he dared eat anything, no matter how small, Asriel would gain a few pounds. He managed to work it off, though, going with his father to the gym.

On the way back home from Alyphus' new labs Asgore couldn't help admiring the new town all around him. It had been a dilapidated suburb of a human city, but when Monsters emerged from underground over a year ago they'd been given it as part of the first negotiations with the humans. It hadn't been much at the time, but within the span of a year the whole place had changed completely.
         Where once there's been sagging shops with dull windows were now brightly painted storefronts. Weed filled, overgrown ares had been cut back, mulched, and landscaped into beautiful parks. Even some of the old high-rise buildings had been completely renovated and, while a little small, were nice places to live. Not everything was done yet of course, many areas were still under construction, but the monsters had taken to the job with cheerful smiles determined to make their new home even better than their old one.
         Feeling good with everything that had happened Asgore wandered across the street to look in a few shop windows. Maybe he'd bring Toriel a present to further spice things up. He'd just stopped to look in a bakery window and was trying to decide between butterscotch or cinnamon apple pie when a strange sensation washed over the former monster king.
         It wasn't painful if anything it felt really good, as evidence by the bulging mass straining his pants. but the heat from it seemed to radiate out into his body. His muscles ached like he'd just gone through a serious workout and his face itched something unpleasant. And strange as it seemed the feeling of tightness in his pants only grew as he stood there leaning against the window.
         Eventually the feelings calmed down and Asgore heaved a sigh of relief, "If that's a side effect..." he began but paused as something seemed wrong. His voice sounded different. Looking in the window at his reflection Asgores eyes popped wide.
         He was... younger.
         Hard as it was to believe, looking back at him was not the bearded, over-the-hill former king he used to be. Now the features that stared back were from a younger thirty-something version of himself he hadn't seen in years. The lines of his face had been smoothed away and the grey in his wheat colored hair was gone. His beard likewise had retracted, giving him some longish sideburns and only a faint mustache.
         Asgore wasn't sure how to feel about such a development. On the one hand any being, human or monster, would pay huge sums to turn back the years like this. And he certainly looked and felt better. Some of the added pounds he'd gotten in middle age had also seemed to melt away giving him a tighter and more toned body.
         On the other hand a lot of questions began to pile up in his mind. What would Toriel think? Would she be happy or mad at him for doing this? And then there was the change itself. Was it actually done or was this just the start of things? Asgore had asked for a large dose of Determination. Maybe it wasn't finished and he should go back to Alphys before it got worse.

We only just started again after coming to the surface. We've only had a handful of subjects tested so far. You were the first to ask for such... *ahem* 'personal' uses for it."
         "So you have no idea why this is happening?" Asgore replied looking deeply worried as he gripped his loose shorts... wait, not fully loose.
         Asgore looked down and could feel the heat rising in his cheeks. The bulge between his legs had to be more than three times anything he'd ever had at any age in his life. It was like he'd stuffed a large melon down his pants, and yet he could tell it was all him.
         Alphys blushed harder as she too noticed the changes, "W-Well, there's no certainties yet, but if we could study what's going on for a while we might get some answers. At a glance though the changes do seem fairly straight forward."
         "You mean Asgore getting younger while his junk gets bigger?" Undyne stated with some small mirth.
         "I-I wouldn't have put it that way," Alphys muttered but yes, that seems to be the case. The good news is he seems to be retaining his adult mind regardless of age. So if the worst should happen and we can't undo it, he might grow back normally on his own."
         "Alright, so how far back is this going to go?" Asgore asked, "Do you even have a guess Alphys?"
         "Well, I can't be sure until more tests, but judging by how much you've lose and how much Determination you were injected with. Maybe..."


Choice one: Teenager, with a package as big as one on a horse.

Choice Two: Pre-teen with a member as long as his leg.

Choice Three: Toddler with a package as big as his whole body.
13512211.title: Alphys examines him.

choices: Not much; the machine fired-up like it should.
135131.content:
Standing in his bathroom, dressed in nothing but a pair of white briefs, Asgore scraped his courage together and climb upon the scale. Anxious, he watched the digital numbers increase, hoping against hope that he didn't gain weight this past month.

He was out of luck, though. The numbers surpassed his previous weight, landing on a sturdy 330 pounds. The former king groaned in frustration.

He couldn't believe that he allowed to let himself go like this. Though, it wasn't entirely his fault; life amongst the humans were good, perhaps a little too good: they had better food, comfortable and peaceful lifestyles, a far cry from the dark and gloomy world known as the Underground.

Asgore got caught up in all the luxury, and, due to him having few responsibilities, for the humans tended to the monsters' needs now, he let himself go, allowing his strong, healthy body to be replaced by a overweight, pudgy one.

He grabbed a handful of his round, tight belly, lifting it up before dropping it. He watched how the ball of lard bounce, slosh, and jiggle.

He really needed to get his old body back. So far, Asgore had tried everything: dieting, working-out, and taking weight-loss medication, but for some reason his fat didn't want to go away.

Recently Asgore, after numerous dates, finally got Toriel to warm up to him again. But she still refused to take him back. He guessed to was repulsed by his fat body.

"I need a quick fix," Asgore decided.

And he knew just where to get one.

XxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxX

Outside of town, on the countryside, lived Undyne and Alphys in a farmhouse. The couple had seen some changes in their lives due to the money that was rolling in. The reason for this was that Alphys, being the genius that she was, sold some of her inventions to the market lately.

The response was that major product companies wanted to make deals with her to manufacture more of her brilliant inventions. They said that it was nothing like they have ever seen before. Now the two lived on the plains outside of the city, where Alphys could build some of the ideas requested to her.

It took a while for Asgore to reach the farmhouse, and even longer to convince the scientist to help him.

"I'm sorry, Asgore, but I can't help you," said Alphys, adjusting her glasses.

They were inside her home, in her room. She had just finished looking at some plans sent to her about a airplane that could run on water instead of gasoline.

"Come on, Alphys," Asgore begged, spreading his arms wide, "Your a genius. There must be something you've invented that could help people lose weight quickly."

Alphys crossed one arm around her chest while the other rubbed her chin, her eyes staring at the ceiling, thinking. "You know what," she said after a pause, "I think I might have something for you. Follow me, please."

Obediently Asgore did as she asked, following her outside. They walked across the lawn until they reached a large barn. But it was not animals that were in this wooden structure. Inside was half-finished inventions, their part scattered across the floor.

To Asgore the place seemed rather untidy, but he didn't complain. They kept walking towards a dark spot in the corner of the barn. Reaching out, Alphys grabbed something something large, pulling it with a few grunts into the light.

It was covered with a brown blanket. Alphys pulled it off, and Asgore saw that underneath it was a machine that looked very similar to a weight lifter. What made it special was that it had a few fancy electronic devices attached to it.

"Ta-da!" Alphys chimed, "I give you the Abb Builder 5000!"

Asgore eyed it skeptically. Alphys seemed to notice this, for she sighed, saying: "I know, I know, it's a pretty silly invention, that's why I haven't sold it to the market yet. It used to be a giant robot that could destroy humans, much like Metaton. This is technically a prototype."

"So," said Asgore, "You dismantled your old invention and used the old parts to build this?"

"O, no," said Alphys, "It's still the same robot, believe it or not. I modify it so that it could transform into a workout machine. It's an idea that I got when I watched a human TV show called Transformers."

"Interesting," said Asgore, "But how does it work?"

"I'll show you," said Alphys, "But before I do that, you must wear some special clothing that comes with the machine."

She turned around, hurrying towards a trunk. She flipped open the lid and began to search inside. A few moments later Alphys returned, holding a yellow suite.

"Here, put this on," she said.

Asgore took it and studied it suspiciously. He shrugged and did as she asked. A while later, Asgore was sitting on the bench, wearing the special suit, his large gut bulging against the fabric.

"I still don't see how this would help me," said Asgore, "This looks like any other workout bench, just with a few more gadgets."

"You see those light above you and on your sides," she said, pointing with her finger.

"Yeah," Asgore said.

"They are meant to stimulate muscle cells in your body," she explained. "Undyne ones used this thing, did you know that?"

Alphys nodded, saying: "She did. Why do you think she's so muscular now?"

A memory appeared in Asgore's mind: only a few weeks ago Undyne had begun with a secret workout routine, and a few days later, much to everyone's surprise, she ended up with a body that could rival a professional bodybuilder.

"So, that's how she did it," said Asgore in wonder.

"Of course," said Alphys, "Now, lay down that I can strap you in and fire up the machine."

Asgore did as he was told. But what happened when Alphys hit the on switch?

135321.content:
It was a cool morning, but the bright blue sky and upcoming sun foretold a hot day, typical for Summer. Making your way down the sidewalk, your backpack hanging heavily on your back, you saw the grey, three-story school come into view, blocking out the sun and casting a long shadow.

"Yo, wait up!" came a cry from behind you.

You stood still for a few moments, watching as the armless monster wearing a black stripped, yellow shirt came running up to you, panting, his bag bouncing against his waist. When he finally stopped, he tripped over his own feet and fell on his face.

You smiled, shaking your head, apparently already used to the monster kid's clumsy behavior. Reaching out, you helped him back to his feet.

"Thanks," he said, "Man, I wish I had arms. I'm already black and blue from falling down so much."

You nodded. It was indeed a blessing to have arms, the very first appendages to spread out to break your fall. You wished you could help your friend, but you didn't have enough Determination, nor even know how to do such an impossible feat.

The only thing you could do now is head inside the school, through the wide open double-door, for the bell had just ran, announcing that lessons for today were about to start.

The class was rowdy at first when the two of you entered: there was a loud buzz as children talked, paper airplanes and erasers flew overhead, and a few children were playing what looked like tic-tac-toe on the blackboard.

Before you took your regular spot in class, you could not help but pause for a few moments, looking at the lively students. Monsters and human, all in one room, interacting with one another like there was no deference between them at all.

A faint, triumphant smile crawled onto your face. Who said a kid can't change the world? Your thoughts were suddenly interrupted when someone entered the room.

"Alright, children, settle down!" Toriel's kind but stern voice carried across the room, having almost instant effect on the students.

When everyone, including you and your friend, who sat next to you, took their seats and finally calmed down, Toriel addressed the class.

"Good morning, students," she greeted.

"Good morning, Miss Dreemurr!" you, alongside the rest, said in unison.

It's usually around this point that she would ask the class if they could remember about their lesson yesterday, but it would seem that things were going to be a little different today.

"Now, class, we have a new student amongst us today," she said, "Tommy, why don't you step up and introduce yourself."

From the front row you someone, a human boy, stand up, from a specific seat you could have sworn was always empty.

Although you despised judging people, you had to admit he looked a little funny with that strange, red helmet he was wearing.

He greeted the class with a wave, saying: "Hi."

"He's almost just as lifeless as you," your friend beside you whispered with a grin, joking.

You responded by rolling your eyes.

"I'm very sure you'll have a wonderful time here, Tommy," Toriel said with a friendly smile.

The boy went back to his desk.

She turned her attention back to the class. "Now, children, if you will take out your text books we can begin with today's lessons," she said.

The class did obediently what she asked, but for some reason you found it hard to concentrate on your lesson. For some unknown reason your gaze was drawn to the direction were the boy sat.

You saw that Tommy's backpack was wide open, revealing his belongings inside. There wasn't much of interest, except a yellow notebook.

You didn't know why this thing drew your attention. Perhaps you were just bored. For ones you wished that the need for writing something in it didn't fill you with Determination.
135321.title: The new kid in town.

choices: Along the way, you meet Tommy, who is searching for his book.
1353212.content:
The school bell rang for the eighth time, announcing that the lessons for today had finally come to an end. The ones quiet and lonely hallways suddenly came alive as both human and monsters left the classrooms, laughing, talking, shouting, their feet tapping audibly across the tiled flooring.

The students in your class were packing up their things too, taking their backpacks and quickly exiting the classroom, leaving it deserted...except for you.

Due to it being a free period, for one of your teachers were absent today, you decided to doze off without the fear of being apprehended for your act. The school bell didn't wake you up, so, you continued to sleep until your armless friend came to wake you, apparently wondering why you didn't follow him outside.

"Yo, Frisk, wake up!" he said, nudging you with his head.

You woke up with a snort and a confused "huh?", looking around you, your eyes falling onto your friend.

"You fell asleep," he stated. "I was half tempted to leave you here. Imagine how funny it would be if you woke up in the middle of the night and discover that your still at school! Though, that would be a little mean, I have to admit."

You shake your head and jump off your stool, but just as you were about to leave, following your friend that had the ability to talk up a storm, you spotted something out of the corner of your eye.

In the back of the class, on the furthest desk to the left, close to the window, you saw a notebook on the table. Curious, you walked towards it, picking it up the yellow book.

"Yeah," your friend began to explain, "It would seem that Tommy forgot his one belonging here, which is strange seeing that he's never parted with it today. Isn't it funny? He takes that notebook everywhere he goes."

You nodded in agreement. You've been watching him the whole, first with mild interest because he was a new face in school, but it grew as he began to act a little bit funny. Everywhere he went, he carried that notebook, even in places where it's completely unnecessary, like the gym and the cafeteria, holding it under his arm.

What was so special about this book, you wondered. You decided to place it in your bag, telling your friend that you would give it back to Tommy tomorrow.

You left the school and headed down the street.

But does anything happen along the way?
1353212.title: After school.

13532121.content:
Your friend lived in the exact same street as you, a few blocks away from your residence, meaning that you had to stop halfway to your home when you reached the front gate leading up to a standard-sized family house.

"See you tomorrow, Frisk," he said.

You would have given him a handshake, but he didn't have any hands. So, you only waved at him as he went through the gate and into the house.

You continued down the street until you reached your home, a large, two-story house. As usual, Toriel was there to welcome you home, who had arrived home earlier today, changing from her work clothes to her normal dress.

When you entered the kitchen, you saw that she was busy searching the food cupboards, muttering, "O, dear, o, dear."

Her hears raised a little, meaning that she heard you, and Toriel turned around, greeting you: "O, hello, my child. I apologize that I didn't notice you at first, but I'm searching for my ingredients to make some Snail Pie. It would seem that I'm all out of them, unfortunately. O, Asgore would be so disappointed! I guess we should make a list of what to buy. Would you mind doing that for me while I check the cupboards again."

You nodded, placing your backpack on the ground, grabbing the first book that you could write, which happened to be the yellow notebook. When you realized this, you hesitated, but not for long, for Toriel already began naming what she needed, and you quickly began to write.

You felt guilty of using someone else's belongings, but you were sure that if you removed the page you were writing on Tommy would not noticed.

So you continued writing, both yours and Toriel's back facing the kitchen's table, completely unaware that everything you were listing - snails, butter, cinnamon, flour, milk, eggs - were appearing on the table behind you.

"O, my!" Toriel exclaimed, dumbfounded when she saw all the things she needed right in front of her. "Now where did this all come from?"

You were surprised as well. Looking at the page you just written on, you saw that the letters were slowly fading away, leaving the page clean ones more. Did you just summon something by just writing something in this notebook?

To test it, you left the kitchen where Toriel was scratching her head in bewilderment, heading towards the privacy of your room. Writing something random such as telephone, the device appeared on your desk.

So, that was why the kid was so protective about the thing; he had a thing that could bend reality, perhaps almost as strong as your ability to reset.

The discovery of this item filled you with Determination, and you reached for the very telephone you just summoned, ready to call up your friend and tell him about your amazing find.

But you hesitated. Perhaps you should mess around with this thing more, just to know how much it could do.

What is your choice?

It was a nice summer morning on the surface and everything was going well for Toriel. She, Frisk, Undyne, and Alphys and went to see a movie. To say it piqued Toriel's interest was an understatement. While yes she WAS 7 feet tall, Toriel couldn't stop wondering if she could get taller. While yes monsters have a limit to height, Toriel had heard from her parents and even her Ex. Husband Asgore, that some boss monsters had giant magic. Unfortunately for Toriel, she only knew healing and fire magic. Nothing more. As she walked down the sidewalk, an object in the grass. This wasn't milk in them..no..they had expanded out by magic. As for her rear, well..She couldn't explain how either. But then she noticed the street light next to her had gone down a bit. 14412.content:
Asriel was sitting next to his bed with the lamp shining on him in his sheets. He was about his mid teens and is starting to notice his changes. He was getting taller (even if he wasn’t quite as tall as his parents), he was starting to grow horns which are now as big as Toriel’s. He was also growing a bit of an appetite and his voice was lowering a tiny bit. He lastly was growing very little blond on his “goatee”.

He was getting worried about the kingdom. He was next in line as King for all of monsters and he noticed that he was starting to get more royal work. All this made him think about his father, Asgore Dreemurr. He has an amazing beard and strong muscles…mostly at least. He always wanted to be like him, but he still had the motherly side (Toriel) of him.
“What should I do?” Asriel whispered to himself.

That’s when he remembered what his mother would always say.
“Eat up, and you’ll grow big and strong.” ‘Maybe I need to have a bit more treats than normal,’ He thought. “Yeah, I just need to eat an extra slices of food and I’ll be as big as dad in no time.” He finally fell into a magnificent slumber, dreaming of being like his father.

“Morning my child.” Toriel spoke cheerfully to her son.” He just waved in yawn. Long story short, he got his special slice of Butterscotch Pie since he's got important work today. Asriel realised this is where he could have a second slice. He was nervous though…

1441222.content:
(Note, the Barrier has been broken for a long time, and humans and monsters have no negative relations with each other, but there are always some racists)

A small town near Mt. Ebbot started hosting its annual pie eating week that consisted of 7 days of competitions. 3 competitions were held every day until the week ended and anybody could join. The 2 people with the most pie eaten at the end of the week face off one more time to determined the champion. Asriel signed himself up for the competition about a month ago, before he wanted to got bigger, but now he was going to try and eat as much as he could.

A buzzer goes off signaling the contestants to start eating, they now had 10 minutes to eat as much as they could. Asriel scarfs down a pie, then another, and another. The buzzer finally went off again and Asriel was stuffed, and was rubbing his firm gut as he waited for his score. Asriel was handed a slip of paper that had 21 boxes, one for each possible competition he could compete in. The first box had 37 in it, Asriel was surprised that he ate more than just 15. He was required to hand his slip back in to the "judges" and he carried off on his way.

Asriel walked around the city for a good 4 hours before the next competition was ready to start. After some encouraging words from his parents Asriel was ready. The clock struck 12 and a loud buzzer rang and Asriel dug into the pie. He ate at a decent pace until there was 2 minutes left and he got a terrible belly cramp. Asriel finished the last bit of pie and he stopped to rub his gut. The final 2 minutes passed without Asriel eating anything, and his final score for that round was a 32.

The Final competition of the day was held 8 hours later giving Asriel enough time to digest all the food. Again a buzzer rang and Asriel started eating as much as he could, pushing himself to his limit. By the end, Asriel managed to eat 43 pies leaving him at a grand total of 102 for the first day. The announcer at the front table was calling out the top 10 people/monsters who ate the most pie and Asriel made 8th on the list, 103 pies behind the person in first. After hearing the results Asriel goes home and eagerly weighs himself. 182 was the final number on the scale and Asriel slumps into his bed and goes to sleep exited for the next day.

14412223.content:
Asriel woke up and his belly no longer looked like an over inflated beach ball and more like a slightly deflated medicine ball. Confused Asriel got out of his bed, put on his almost ill fitting robe and went into the bathroom. He stepped onto the scale while rubbing his soft gut and was surprised to see that he now weighed 231 pounds. Asriel was told a few times about how monsters had adapted to eating food made of mostly, or completely out of magic, and how that eating food that was not made of magic usually had more of an effect on the body than it normally would. Before he could think about much else he looked at the clock and panicked, he only had 30 minutes to get to the morning competition or he couldn't compete.


Asriel had never run as fast as he did in that moment making it to the competition in 10 minutes even with the extra weight. In the 20 minutes Asriel had left, he just used to catch his breath. The time came for the morning competition to start and Asriel was more than ready. The Timer began to tick down and Asriel was stuffing himself with pie after pie, making quick work of anything that was put in front of him. He never seemed to slow his pace down and by the end of the time he still could of eaten more. Asriel got his score card and was amazed at what it said. Asriel managed to eat 93 pies in just 10 minutes.


Asriel stared at his gut, giving it a few pats making it jiggle for a few second before stopping. Now he knew how his dad could pack away so much food, it was the extra room his large gut gave him. Asriel, like yesterday, walked around the town until the next competition was set to start. Asriel took a seat at a table and his stomach let out a loud growl. 15212221.content:

Chara didn't need telling twice and immediately turned the knob on the tank and watched in awe as Toriel began to gulp down water. Chara giggled, she liked her mother getting bigger like this. Chara laid on Toriel's expanding belly hearing the water slightly slosh and her head against Toriel's breast's like pillows. This caused Asriel to be even more jealous.

153.content:
.Woooooooo!

Splat!

You had plummeted far, but, luckily, the yellow flower bed had broken your fall. With a groan, you sat up and looked around, rubbing your head and wondering where you were.

It was rather dark, the only light coming down from the hole in the cavern's ceiling. You narrowed your eyes, trying to see in the gloom, and spotted the outline of a archway.

Deciding that sitting around would get you nowhere, you stood up and walked towards the archway. When you passed through it, you found yourself in a strange landscape.

Scattered stones, rundown walls and building were everywhere, plant life growing over the ruins, surrounding you like some kind of maze.

You decide to press forward, but, as you walked down the many pathways, coming several times to a dead end, you had the feeling you were being watched.

You saw a shadow moving in the corner of your eye and heard small footsteps behind you, but when you checked you saw nothing.

After a while you regretted entering the maze, for you soon found yourself lost. You tried re-tracing your steps, but found yourself moving even deeper into the ruins.

With a frustrated sigh, you gave up and sat on a nearby block of stone, wondering why you ever thought that it would have been a good idea to explore the mountain.

It was then that he made his appearance. Out of the shadows walked a monster. He was a child, having the appearance of a goat, wearing a stripped shirt and brown pants.

You were were startled when you saw him and wanted to run away, but the goat boy quickly said, "No, please, don't run. I'm not going to hurt you. I just want to talk."

You saw that he looked just as frightened as you, and you relaxed, allowing him to approach you.

"Here, have this," he gave you a few yellow flowers, which you accepted happily, sniffing the sweet scent, liking the monster already.

"I've never seen or talked to a human before," he said, "The others say that they're bad, but I don't think so. Can we be friends? My name is Asriel. What's yours?"

You said that you would gladly be his friend and told your name.

Asriel's face brightened and he said, "Frisk. That sounds lovely. By the way, you seem to be lost. I'll help you out of here. I know this place like the back of my hand!"

You accepted his help and walked alongside him.

"You should meet my parents," Asriel continued, "They're the king and queen of the Underground. They're the best, especially my mom, who's a wonderful good. She makes the best pies in the world!"

You said you wanted to meet his parents and the two of you left the ruins.

What happened next?
153.title: The Frisk time line.

1531.content:
Through the Underground you and Asriel traveled, climbing on a boat, which was steered by a mysterious, hooded figure ("Tra la la la!" he sang, but then stopped and said, "A human? Well, that's something I haven't seen before, though a change of cargo ones and a while is good.")

After that, you arrived at a frozen wonderland, where Asriel introduced you to many friends of his and residence of Snowden. Though, you struggled to concentrate, for it was freezing, but the goat boy didn't seem to mind the cold.

But the place Asriel took you next made you long for the low temperatures. After riding an elevator, you arrived at a place called the Hotlands, where it was very hot.

But Asriel was kind enough to buy you some ice cream called Nice cream from a nearby stand, which you ate, and it was nice.

After traveling around in Hotlands for a while, you asked the goat boy where he was going, and he said, "To Alphys' house. She's one of my aunts and my family's royal scientist. She's a little bit of an introvert, but she's pretty sweet ones you get to know her. Alphys has this crazy obsession with these cartoons, but when I call them a cartoon she gets upset and insists that it's called Anime. To me, they'te still a bunch of cartoon. Anyway, she also likes humans, so I think she would really like to see you."

What Asriel told you about Alphys sounded very good, and you did want to meet her, but, unfortunately, when you arrived at her home, you saw that there was a notice on the door, which read, "Off to a Anime convention. Will be back later. P.S. there not cartoons! :("

"Well this sucks," said Asriel after he read the note, "I guess we have to come back later, then."

You were disappointed, but you and Asriel pressed onwards. You arrived at a place where it rained a lot, and the goat boy pulled out an umbrella from a conveniently placed umbrella stand.

"There free," he said, "but, unfortunately, we can only use one, so we have to share. My dad really needs to change these rules. They're kinda outdated."

After passing through the rain, you and Asriel arrived at a landscape where many rivers were running. Some had bridges you could used to cross them, but others you had to swim through, but luckily the waters were only waist deep.

As you walked, you noticed a few well-concealed pathways branches from the main path.

When you asked Asriel about them, he said, "The Temmies live town there in Temmie Town. They have very deep history."

When you asked about the history, Asriel shrugged and said, "Dunno. In fact, no one does. We should ask them some time."

Soon you arrived at another elevator, and it took you and Asriel to your destination. The monsters' city lay before you, and you followed the goat boy, walking down a long road.

When you asked what the city's name was, Asriel said, "It's called New Home. Great name, I know, but my dad isn't very creative when it comes to naming things. If you asked me, I would've called it Happy monster town or Pixel city."

There was no sarcasm in his voice, so you concluded that the goat boy, like his father, wasn't very creative when it came to naming things either. You arrived at a large house, and you and Asriel went inside.

"Welcome to my home," said the goat boy.

And when the sweet scent of something baking reached him, he continued, "And I think my mom's cooking up some of that wonderful pies I told you about. Let's go introduce you to her."

You turned left and went to the kitchen, where Toriel, indeed, was busy baking several pies, and another burly monster, which you guessed was Asriel's father, was sitting at the table.

"Hey, mom and dad, I made a new friend that I'd like you to meet," announced Asriel.

There reaction wasn't like you expected, which made you glad. They were surprised, as if their son had brought home a surreal but beautiful piece of art, but they calmed down and Toriel was the first to speak.

"Well, that's nice, my child," she said to Asriel, and to you she said, "Please, tell us your name and how on earth did you get down here?"

Toriel's kind attitude and the motherly tone she used to speak to you made you trust her quickly, and you told her your name and how you accidentally fell down a hole into the Underground.

"How dreadful," said Toriel.

You asked them if there perhaps was a way out, and Asgore answered by saying, "I'm sorry, but the magical barrier keeps us all down here, at least until the prophecy is fulfilled. I'm afraid you're stuck here like the rest of us, but don't fret, we will take you in a raise you like our own."

You were dismayed at what Asgore told you, but you still believed that there had to be a way out. There must be...

"Pushing that bleak note aside," said Toriel, "Who wants some freshly baked cinnamon and butterscotch pie?"

On cue, Asriel's belly began to rumble, and he cried, "I do! I do!"

You were a little hungry too, and you agreed to have slice as well. After eating two slices, you were full, but Asriel, to your surprise, managed to eat two whole pies and still wanted more.

Afterwards, it was off to bed in a cozy room that you shared with Asriel. But long after everyone went to sleep, you lay awake for very long in bed, thinking of way out the Underground, for you didn't belong there...and neither did any of these monsters. They were so kind and friendly. Why seal them down here?

What plan did you come up with?

Choice 1: you remembered what Asgore said about a prophecy and ask Asriel about it the following morning. You discovered that it involves someone growing to a ridiculous size through some means.

Choice 2: you remembered Alphys and how Asriel said that she was the royal scientist. If she was as smart as he said, perhaps she could find a way out of the Underground.

A little magic versus science could have been all what the monsters needed to break the barrier.
1531.title: Tour of the Underground and a hard truth.

155212.title: Welcome home.

1552121.content:
Toriel was excited and she couldn't stop chattering as she drove, nearly getting emotional, and it was getting on Susie's nerve, but Kris didn't seem to mind. It wasn't the first time she did this.

When Asriel went to college for the first time, Toriel wept and refused to let him go, and he almost missed his bus as the result.

And that was where they were going today, to pick up Asriel for the Summer break. Susie had tagged along, curious to see what her friend's brother looked like.

They were strapped in the backseat, the front seat left open especially for Asriel. There was a crowd of monsters of all types who where there to welcome their sons and daughters home from college when Toriel parked her car.

The buses had pulled in, and students were climbing out, welcomed by the eager arms of their relatives.

Susie and Kris struggled to keep up with Toriel as she frantically searched for her son. When she spotted him, she gave a cry of joy and ran to him, her arms wide open.

Kris and Susie finally managed to make their way through the crowd and spotted her hugging her slightly embarrassed son.

Susie had to admit that Asriel wasn't exactly what she expected he would be. In fact, he was a bit more. He was tall, but wide too. She wouldn't say obese, but he was fat.

Kris told Susie that it was due to years of their mom spoiling him. He wore a hoodie over his shirt, which had the same stripes as Kris'.

After the warm welcome from his mom, Toriel took him to meet the others.

"Nice to meet you," said Asriel, shaking her hand, towering over her by at least a head taller.

The blond tips on his hair, white fur and curving horns reminded her of Ralsei. For some reason she found herself blushing, remaining silent.

Kris grinned, surprised and amused that, for the first time, Susie looked embarrassed and flustered.

Something told Kris that Susie liked her brother.

They climbed back in the car, Toriel wanting to know everything that happened at college and if he ate well, fussing about how he seemed to have lost weight, only for Asriel to say that he actually gained ten pounds.

As they drove back home, Kris observed that Susie was very silent and looked uncomfortable.
1552121.title: Welcome home!
